surfaces
Interface ISurface

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractSurface, CheckersSurface, FlatSurface, TextureSurface
public interface ISurface

This interface represents the surface of each object in the scene. There are several surfaces (i.e Flat, Checkers , Texture).

Method Summary
 void commit()
          Finishes parsing the surface and validates that all mandatory values were given and valid.
 IColor getAmbient()
          Returns the ambient intensity (color) of the surface.
 IColor getColor(Intersection hit, Scene scene, int iteration)
          Returns the color of the surface at a given intersection point.
 IColor getDiffuse()
          Returns the diffuse intensity (color) of the surface.
 IColor getEmission()
          Returns the emission intensity (color) of the surface.
 double getReflectance()
          Returns the reflectance coefficient of the surface.
 double getShininess()
          Returns the shininess factor of the surface.
 IColor getSpecular()
          Returns the specular intensity (color) of the surface.
 java.lang.String getType()
          Returns the type of the surface.
 void parseParameter(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String[] args)
          Parses the given parameters to create a surface for a scene object.
 void setAmbient(IColor ambient)
          Sets the ambient intensity (color) of the surface.
 void setDiffuse(IColor diffuse)
          Sets the diffuse intensity (color) of the surface.
 void setEmission(IColor emission)
          Sets the emission intensity (color) of the surface.
 void setReflectance(double reflectance)
          Sets the reflectance coefficient of the surface.
 void setShininess(double shininess)
          Sets the shininess factor of the surface (default 100).
 void setSpecular(IColor specular)
          Sets the specular intensity (color) of the surface.

getColor

IColor getColor(Intersection hit,
                Scene scene,
                int iteration)
Returns the color of the surface at a given intersection point.

Parameters:
hit - The intersection information.
scene - The scene.
iteration - The iteration number (used for reflectance). Use the value 0.
Returns:
The color of the surface at a given intersection point.
